page.title: 20Nibley watchers 1985.
page.content: The survey of the North Nibley area was made by third year pupils of Rednock School,Dursley.Two classes,3D and 3U used time in History and Geography to prepare and conduct the survey.This amounted to 3 hours a week but many gave more time.None of the pupils live in Nibley and expeditions in the school minibus proved to be both essential and interesting.A day at the shop;a morning on the farm;a tour of the pub;interviewing residents at home:all proved to be valuable to both interviewers and interviewees.One parent had been brought up in the Black Horse and was able to highlight the changes that have taken place in the last 30 years.History,via the survey,was being made and being remade.To ALL who helped,especially the people of Nibley,MANY THANKS.
